text: I've been using a global (temporal) mean pooling for timeseries classification (many-to-one). I've seen this in other papers and it felt right to try to retrieve a global vector representing the whole timeseries without prioritizing recent events (which would happen if I used only the last hidden state, for example). However, max pooling would work (in principle) just as well. Has anyone experienced with both? A third alternative would be attention-based, of course.
